column4: are there anywhere in Ubuntu to set my video output preferences besides "Screen Resolution"?
run 'gksu displayconfig-gtk'
thanks
np
is there a way to enable the secondary screen from that window?
yep. i haven't used it, but it's there
I can only either set it as the default screen or disabled
then chances are you need to make sure you have the right video driver. it can help you with that too. there's a handy test button as well
I know it's possible to output the video to TV, but dunno how.  when I'm in the login screen it's output to TV but when I'm logged in it's not
i have no experience with that. sorry
yes
what are they? are they needed?
you mean, before it finishes logging in? or after?
I mean the time after you enter your login credentials and when your desktop shows up
_after_ desktop shows up, and everything seems done?
yes
well, some things are scheduled
but as for user apps, you can check your sessions applet
what I'm seeing is when the login screen is displayed, the computer outputs video to TV, but when I'm logged in, it doesn't do that
System > Prefs > Sessions
I'm wondering if any program is launched during that time that would change that
weird. i don't know much about that though
